title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Thessalonians chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:1, what do the brethren pray for?
options: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
That they may have riches and power
That they may receive wisdom and knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:1 asks the brethren to pray so that the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified.

questions.question: What kind of men does Paul ask to be delivered from in 2 Thessalonians 3:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Unreasonable and wicked men
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:2 specifically mentions deliverance from unreasonable and wicked men.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:3, who is faithful and will keep you from evil?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:3 declares that the Lord is faithful and will establish and keep you from evil.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 3:4, Paul expresses confidence in the Lord concerning what?
options: That the Thessalonians do and will do the things commanded
That the Thessalonians will receive gifts
That the Thessalonians will prosper financially
That the Thessalonians will travel safely
questions.correctAnswer: That the Thessalonians do and will do the things commanded
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:4 shows Paul's confidence in the Lord regarding the Thessalonians obeying the commands given.

questions.question: What does Paul ask the Lord to direct the hearts of the Thessalonians into, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:5?
options: The love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:5 requests that the Lord direct hearts into the love of God and patient waiting for Christ.

questions.question: What command does Paul give in 2 Thessalonians 3:6 regarding disorderly brethren?
options: Withdraw yourselves from every disorderly brother
Write letters to every disorderly brother
questions.correctAnswer: Withdraw yourselves from every disorderly brother
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:6 commands to withdraw from any brother walking disorderly and not according to tradition.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:8, Paul and his companions ate the bread of others without working.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:8 states that Paul and his companions did not eat anyone's bread for free but worked night and day.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:9, why did Paul and his companions work instead of using their power not to?
options: To make themselves an example for the believers to follow
To earn money for the church
questions.correctAnswer: To make themselves an example for the believers to follow
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:9 explains their labor was to be an example for others.

questions.question: What does 2 Thessalonians 3:10 say should happen to anyone who will not work?
questions.correctAnswer: Neither should he eat
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:10 clearly states that if anyone will not work, neither should he eat.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:11, some among the Thessalonians were described as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Disorderly and busybodies
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:11 mentions some walking disorderly and busybodies, working not at all.

questions.question: What does Paul command those who are disorderly to do in 2 Thessalonians 3:12?
options: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.correctAnswer: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:12 commands disorderly members to work quietly and eat their own bread.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 3:13 encourages believers to become weary in well doing.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:13 instructs brethren not to be weary in well doing.

questions.question: What should be done if anyone does not obey the word in the epistle, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:14?
options: Note him and have no company with him
questions.correctAnswer: Note him and have no company with him
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:14 instructs to note such a person and have no company with him to shame him.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Thessalonians 3:15 says to count the disobedient as enemies.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:15 says to admonish them as brothers, not to count them as enemies.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 2 Thessalonians 3:16: 'Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: means
questions.explanation: The verse 2 Thessalonians 3:16 says, 'Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means.'

medium.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged because some people around them do not have faith and act wickedly. Based on 2 Thessalonians 3, what biblical truth would you share about God's faithfulness?
options: God is faithful and will establish and keep you from evil
God will remove all difficulties immediately
Faith is not important in trials
You must rely only on your own strength
questions.correctAnswer: God is faithful and will establish and keep you from evil
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:3 reminds us that the Lord is faithful and will establish us and keep us from evil. This encourages trust in God's protection despite the presence of those without faith (verses 2, 3, and 5).

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 3 teach us about the importance of prayer in evangelism and witnessing?
options: Pray that the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
questions.correctAnswer: Pray that the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
questions.explanation: Verse 1 encourages believers to pray that the word of the Lord may spread freely and be honored, highlighting prayer’s key role in evangelism and witness (verses 1, 2, and 5).

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3, what should the church do about a brother who walks disorderly and does not follow the traditions taught?
options: Encourage him to continue his ways
questions.correctAnswer: Withdraw yourselves from him
questions.explanation: Verse 6 commands believers to withdraw from any brother who walks disorderly and does not follow the apostolic traditions, emphasizing discipline and correction (verses 6, 14, and 15).

questions.question: What example did Paul and his companions set for believers regarding work ethic according to 2 Thessalonians 3?
options: They worked night and day to avoid being a burden
They relied on others to provide for them
They did not work at all
questions.correctAnswer: They worked night and day to avoid being a burden
questions.explanation: Verses 7 and 8 show Paul and his companions working tirelessly to avoid being a burden, teaching believers to work diligently and responsibly (verses 7, 8, 9, and 10).

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 3 instruct the church to handle those who refuse to work and live idly?
options: They should not eat if they refuse to work
They should be given more help
questions.correctAnswer: They should not eat if they refuse to work
questions.explanation: Verse 10 clearly states that if anyone will not work, neither should he eat, emphasizing the responsibility of personal labor (verses 10, 11, and 12).

questions.question: A believer is growing weary in doing good works. What encouragement does 2 Thessalonians 3 offer?
options: Do not grow weary in well doing
Wait for others to do good works
questions.correctAnswer: Do not grow weary in well doing
questions.explanation: Verse 13 exhorts believers to persist in good works without becoming weary, encouraging perseverance in spiritual discipline (verses 13, 5, and 3).

questions.question: What attitude should believers have toward a brother who disobeys the teachings in this epistle, according to 2 Thessalonians 3?
options: Do not associate with him to shame him but do not count him as an enemy
Treat him as an enemy and avoid all contact
Immediately expel him from the church
questions.correctAnswer: Do not associate with him to shame him but do not count him as an enemy
questions.explanation: Verses 14 and 15 instruct the church to avoid company with disobedient members to shame them, yet still admonish them as brothers, showing love and discipline (verses 14 and 15).

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3, how should believers direct their hearts in relation to God and Christ?
options: Into the love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Into the love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 5 teaches believers to have their hearts directed toward God's love and patiently await Christ’s coming, emphasizing faith and hope (verses 3, 5, and 13).

questions.question: True or False: Paul claims he and his companions had the right to be supported but chose to work to set an example.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that Paul and his companions had the power to be supported but worked to set an example for believers, emphasizing integrity in work (verses 7, 8, and 9).

questions.question: True or False: The Lord of peace gives peace to believers only occasionally and under limited circumstances.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 16 declares that the Lord of peace gives peace always by all means, indicating continual and comprehensive peace for believers (verses 3, 16, and 5).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul commands believers to work with ____, so they may eat their own bread.
questions.correctAnswer: quietness
questions.explanation: Verse 12 commands those idle to work quietly, emphasizing humble, diligent labor to provide for themselves (verses 11, 12, and 10).

questions.question: How does 2 Thessalonians 3 exemplify the virtue of humility in daily living?
options: By working to avoid being a burden on others
By seeking praise for their work
questions.correctAnswer: By working to avoid being a burden on others
questions.explanation: Verses 7-9 describe Paul and companions working to avoid being a burden, modeling humility and responsibility in Christian living (verses 7, 8, and 9).

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3, what role does patience play in the Christian life?
options: Patiently waiting for Christ is part of God’s love direction
Patience is only for the old
questions.correctAnswer: Patiently waiting for Christ is part of God’s love direction
questions.explanation: Verse 5 directs believers to have hearts set on the love of God and patient waiting for Christ, underscoring patience as essential in faith and hope (verses 5 and 13).

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul’s personal salutation at the end of 2 Thessalonians 3?
options: It authenticates the letter as his own writing
It is a formality with no special meaning
It indicates the letter was copied by others
It replaces the need for prayer
questions.correctAnswer: It authenticates the letter as his own writing
questions.explanation: Verse 17 notes that Paul signs with his own hand as a token in every epistle, authenticating the letter and showing personal care (verses 17 and 18).

questions.question: How should Christians respond to disorderly conduct in the church according to 2 Thessalonians 3?
options: Withdraw from them and admonish them as brothers
questions.correctAnswer: Withdraw from them and admonish them as brothers
questions.explanation: Verses 6, 14, and 15 teach withdrawal from disorderly brethren for correction, but also admonish them lovingly as brothers, balancing discipline with restoration.

hard.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3.

questions.question: What is the primary request Paul makes in prayer at the beginning of 2 Thessalonians 3?
options: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
That the believers may have wealth and prosperity
That the temple in Jerusalem be rebuilt
That the Roman authorities grant them peace
questions.correctAnswer: That the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly requests prayer so that 'the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified' as stated in 2 Thessalonians 3:1, emphasizing the importance of the gospel's progress.

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 3:2, Paul asks to be delivered from what kind of men?
questions.correctAnswer: Unreasonable and wicked men
questions.explanation: Verse 2 requests deliverance specifically from 'unreasonable and wicked men,' highlighting the opposition Paul faced.

questions.question: Which attribute of God is emphasized in 2 Thessalonians 3:3 to assure the believers?
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness
questions.explanation: The verse states, 'But the Lord is faithful,' highlighting God's trustworthiness in establishing and protecting the believers from evil.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his behavior among the Thessalonians to set an example in 2 Thessalonians 3:7-8?
options: Not disorderly and working night and day
questions.correctAnswer: Not disorderly and working night and day
questions.explanation: Paul stresses that he did not behave disorderly and worked laboriously to avoid being a burden, as per verses 7 and 8.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Paul's labor according to 2 Thessalonians 3:9?
options: To be an example to follow
questions.correctAnswer: To be an example to follow
questions.explanation: Paul explains in verse 9 that he labors not for lack of power but to set an example for the believers to imitate.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:10, what is the consequence for those unwilling to work?
options: They should be supported by the church
questions.correctAnswer: They should not eat
questions.explanation: Paul commands that if anyone refuses to work, they should not eat, emphasizing personal responsibility (verse 10).

questions.question: What behavior does Paul condemn among some believers in 2 Thessalonians 3:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Walking disorderly and being busybodies
questions.explanation: Paul addresses those who walk disorderly and are busybodies, indicating disruptive and idle behavior (verse 11).

questions.question: What does Paul command those who are disorderly and idle to do in 2 Thessalonians 3:12?
options: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.correctAnswer: Work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts the disorderly to work quietly and support themselves, reflecting the theme of personal responsibility (verse 12).

questions.question: What encouragement does Paul give to the brethren in 2 Thessalonians 3:13?
options: Be not weary in well doing
questions.correctAnswer: Be not weary in well doing
questions.explanation: Paul encourages persistence and endurance in doing good works despite difficulties (verse 13).

questions.question: What is the prescribed action toward those who disobey Paul's instructions in this epistle according to 2 Thessalonians 3:14?
options: Have no company with them to shame them
questions.correctAnswer: Have no company with them to shame them
questions.explanation: Paul instructs to note disobedient individuals and avoid company with them so they may feel shame and repent (verse 14).

questions.question: How should believers treat those who disobey but are admonished, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:15?
options: Count them as brothers, not enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Count them as brothers, not enemies
questions.explanation: Paul advises to admonish such individuals as brothers, emphasizing restoration and love rather than enmity (verse 15).

questions.question: What blessing does Paul invoke for the believers in 2 Thessalonians 3:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace always by all means
questions.explanation: Paul prays that 'the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means,' highlighting spiritual tranquility (verse 16).

questions.question: What unique feature does Paul mention about his writing in 2 Thessalonians 3:17?
options: He writes the salutation with his own hand
questions.correctAnswer: He writes the salutation with his own hand
questions.explanation: Paul states that the salutation is written with his own hand as a token in every epistle, authenticating his letters (verse 17).

questions.question: The instruction in 2 Thessalonians 3:6 to withdraw from a brother walking disorderly reflects which Old Testament concept?
options: Avoiding the wicked to maintain holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Avoiding the wicked to maintain holiness
questions.explanation: This command parallels Old Testament admonitions such as in Psalm 1:1, where avoiding the company of the wicked preserves righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:10, Paul’s instruction implies that work is a moral obligation for believers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Paul clearly states that those unwilling to work should not eat, implying work is a moral duty within the community (verse 10).

theological.title: 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:1, what do the believers pray for regarding the word of the Lord?
options: That it may have free course and be glorified
That it may be hidden from the wicked
That it may be written anew
That it may be limited to the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: That it may have free course and be glorified
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:1 asks believers to pray so that the word of the Lord may have free course and be glorified, reflecting the biblical theme of God's word prevailing (Isaiah 55:11; Psalm 107:20; Hebrews 4:12; John 17:17).

questions.question: What does Paul request deliverance from in 2 Thessalonians 3:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Unreasonable and wicked men
questions.explanation: Paul prays for deliverance from unreasonable and wicked men (2 Thessalonians 3:2), consistent with biblical warnings against evil men (Matthew 10:16; 2 Timothy 3:13; Psalm 37:1; Romans 16:17).

questions.question: What attribute of God is highlighted in 2 Thessalonians 3:3 concerning the protection of believers?
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness
questions.explanation: 2 Thessalonians 3:3 emphasizes God's faithfulness in establishing believers and keeping them from evil, echoing God's dependable nature (Lamentations 3:22-23; Deuteronomy 7:9; 1 Corinthians 1:9; Hebrews 10:23).

questions.question: In 2 Thessalonians 3:5, what does Paul pray the Lord will direct the believers’ hearts into?
options: The love of God and patient waiting for Christ
Fear of the Lord and immediate judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The love of God and patient waiting for Christ
questions.explanation: Paul prays for the Lord to direct hearts into the love of God and patient waiting for Christ (2 Thessalonians 3:5), aligning with themes of divine love and eschatological hope (Romans 5:5; Galatians 5:22; James 5:7; 1 Corinthians 13:4-7).

questions.question: What does Paul command the brethren to do in 2 Thessalonians 3:6 regarding disorderly brothers?
questions.correctAnswer: Withdraw from them
questions.explanation: Paul commands withdrawal from disorderly brothers (2 Thessalonians 3:6) as a disciplinary measure, consistent with church discipline principles (Matthew 18:15-17; 1 Corinthians 5:11; Titus 3:10; Romans 16:17).

questions.question: According to 2 Thessalonians 3:8, how did Paul and his companions conduct themselves among the Thessalonians?
options: They worked laboriously night and day
They avoided work to preach more
questions.correctAnswer: They worked laboriously night and day
questions.explanation: Paul and his companions worked laboriously night and day to avoid being chargeable to anyone (2 Thessalonians 3:8), reflecting apostolic examples of toil (Acts 20:34; 1 Corinthians 4:12; 1 Thessalonians 2:9; 1 Corinthians 9:15-18).

questions.question: What reason does Paul give in 2 Thessalonians 3:9 for working rather than exercising their right to be supported?
options: To be an example to believers
questions.correctAnswer: To be an example to believers
questions.explanation: Paul explains that they worked not because they lacked power but to be an example (2 Thessalonians 3:9), teaching the value of responsible labor (1 Corinthians 11:1; Philippians 3:17; 1 Timothy 4:12; 1 Thessalonians 1:6).

questions.question: What principle does Paul establish in 2 Thessalonians 3:10 about those who refuse to work?
options: If anyone will not work, neither should he eat
questions.correctAnswer: If anyone will not work, neither should he eat
questions.explanation: Paul commands that those unwilling to work should not eat (2 Thessalonians 3:10), enforcing community responsibility (Proverbs 6:6-11; 1 Timothy 5:8; 2 Thessalonians 3:12; Ephesians 4:28).

questions.question: How does Paul describe those walking disorderly in 2 Thessalonians 3:11?
options: Those who work not at all but are busybodies
questions.correctAnswer: Those who work not at all but are busybodies
questions.explanation: Paul describes disorderly people as those who do not work and are busybodies (2 Thessalonians 3:11), condemning idleness and meddling (1 Timothy 5:13; Proverbs 14:23; 2 Thessalonians 3:6-12; Titus 3:14).

questions.question: What instruction does Paul give in 2 Thessalonians 3:12 to those who are disorderly?
options: To work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.correctAnswer: To work quietly and eat their own bread
questions.explanation: Paul commands disorderly believers to work quietly and eat their own bread (2 Thessalonians 3:12), promoting self-sufficiency and peace (Ephesians 4:28; Proverbs 16:3; Colossians 3:23; 1 Thessalonians 4:11).

questions.question: What encouragement does Paul offer to the brethren in 2 Thessalonians 3:13?
options: Do not be weary in well doing
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be weary in well doing
questions.explanation: Paul encourages believers not to grow weary in well doing (2 Thessalonians 3:13), encouraging perseverance in godly living (Galatians 6:9; Hebrews 12:1; Romans 12:11; 1 Corinthians 15:58).

questions.question: What should be done if a man does not obey the words of the epistle, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:14?
options: Note him and have no company with him
questions.correctAnswer: Note him and have no company with him
questions.explanation: Paul instructs to note and have no company with disobedient men to shame them (2 Thessalonians 3:14), consistent with church discipline (Matthew 18:15-17; 1 Corinthians 5:5; Titus 3:10; 2 John 9).

questions.question: How are believers instructed to treat those who disobey but are admonished, according to 2 Thessalonians 3:15?
options: Count him not as an enemy but admonish as a brother
questions.correctAnswer: Count him not as an enemy but admonish as a brother
questions.explanation: Believers should admonish disobedient brethren as brothers, not enemies (2 Thessalonians 3:15), showing love in correction (Galatians 6:1; Proverbs 27:5; Hebrews 12:6; 2 Corinthians 2:6-8).

questions.question: What blessing does Paul invoke on the believers in 2 Thessalonians 3:16?
options: The Lord of peace give you peace always
The Lord send angels to fight for you
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord of peace give you peace always
questions.explanation: Paul prays that the Lord of peace gives peace always (2 Thessalonians 3:16), aligning with Christ as the Prince of Peace (Isaiah 9:6; John 14:27; Philippians 4:7; Colossians 3:15).

questions.question: What unique feature does Paul mention about the salutation in 2 Thessalonians 3:17?
options: It is written with his own hand
It is sung as a hymn
It is written in Greek and Latin
questions.correctAnswer: It is written with his own hand
questions.explanation: Paul notes the salutation is written with his own hand as a token in every epistle (2 Thessalonians 3:17), emphasizing authenticity (Galatians 6:11; Colossians 4:18; 1 Corinthians 16:21; 2 Corinthians 10:10).
